course_title: Topics in Literary History: Literature & Videogames
class_notes:
(Same as GER 277 1)
Digital games frequently integrate and adapt the narrative conventions of printed literature as well as cinema and television, while placing them within new contexts of interactive gameplay. In this course, we will delve back into three general literary trends of the past two centuries (detective fiction, realism, and modernism,), consider how their techniques and structures are integrated and adapted by contemporary, aesthetically ambitious digital games. Building on our knowledge of both literary works and contemporary games, we will go on to collaboratively develop our own simple narrative games, with both a text-based and first-person 3D interface.
course_description: Long historical surveys of national, regional, or ethnic traditions; or of genres or subgenres. Examples: History of African Literature, History of Latinx Literature, History of Science Fiction, History of the Sonnet, History of Southern U.S. Literature, History of Drama.
